attributes.action: Provide funding now for appropriate facilities for those with Severe ED aged 25+
attributes.additional_details:
Those who were failed at the time of their first diagnosis of ED, waiting 18m for 1st appointment - the time for recovery at an early stage gone, are now still being failed by the systems as they are focused on those under 25. 
There are a vast number of people 25+ who are stuck in the revolving door of ED treatment. This is deeply dangerous, 1in 5 die as a result of ED. 
There needs to be NOW supported living facilities where these people can be supported at whatever weight.
attributes.background: There aren't enough appropriate step down supported facilities for those classified as having 'Severe and Enduring Eating Disorders' (SEED), nor supportive care in the community. Those aged 25+ can be desperately ill due to the failures of the ED systems when they were 1st diagnosed 18m wait.

signatures_by_constituency.mp: Rt Hon Sir Mike Penning MP
signatures_by_constituency.name: Hemel Hempstead
